title: Riak Recap for September 3 - 6
description:
Evening, Afternoon, Morning To All -

For today’s Recap: meetups, new code, new production users, blog posts, and more.

Enjoy.

Mark

Riak Recap for September 3 – 6

  1. Nick Campbell built an app using Riak and Luwak for Node Knockout.
    → Go see if you can break it here
    → A few details on the app here
    Anyone else use Riak for a Node Knockout app?
  2. Juliano Martinez let it leak that he added support for Riak to the S3 Clone he is working on.
    → Code here on GitHub
  3. Chad DePue (@chaddepue) wrote a great blog post about his experience using and working with Riak over the past year.
    → Read here
    → There was also a lively discussion about the post on Hacker News
  4. Jon Brisbin’s talk from Erlang Factory about Riak and RabbitMQ is online (PDF and video).
    → Watch here
  5. I wrote up a blog post detailing all the Riak-related events in September.
    → Read here
  6. Two Common Lisp Libraries for Riak appeared today (obviously both are still quite nascent but definitely worth keeping an eye on).
    → https://github.com/eriknomitch/cl-riak
    → https://github.com/whee/cl-riak
  7. Two great jobs to pass along:
    → HP Cloud Services in Seattle is hiring developers with Riak skills. Details here.
    → Thoughtleadr in San Francisco is hiring a Linux Admin with Riak with
    experience. Details here.
